That the state 's high court would rule against a death - row inmate is hardly surprising .
Georgia courts have rarely voted to spare anyone from execution .
Georgia courts have rarely voted to spare anyone from execution .
But that it would keep the courts ignorant of what goes on in the state 's death chamber seems like an unusual abdication of judicial power .
Georgia passed its secrecy law in March 2013 after its supply of pentobarbital , its primary execution drug , expired .
Officials were having trouble getting more , thanks to an export ban by the EU and the refusal of international pharmaceutical companies to sell the drugs for the use in executions .
